page.title: 18THE PRISON IN STARTFORTH
page.content: The army left the town about 15 years ago bringing a drastic reduction in population and jobs and changing the town's character.Only Barford Camp still remains,two others have reverted to farmland and Deerbolt became a Borstol,Streatlam,the Borstal farm.The Officers'quarters house Borstal staff and married quarters were taken by the Council.The Borstal,now known as the Youth Custody Centre in Startforth , overlooks the castle and the River Tees.It's site was once an army camp. When the army left,the Home Office took over the camp to house young offenders while they built themselves a new Borstol.The Borstal opened in 1973.Tradesmen were employed to help the boys.The work was delayed for a year while the site was cleared of bombs.In 1983 private builders had to finish the work.
